We know and share your concerns about the spread of the COVID-19 virus in our community. Our primary focus is the safety of our SANDS members, partners, families, and our Scituate neighbors. We are closely monitoring the situation and will follow recommendations from credible government entities like the CDC, State, Federal and Town of Scituate Board of Health, Police and Fire Departments. Staying out of the public and avoiding interactions with the public at large will help maintain the recommended social distancing and help us and the general public from being contaminated. h2.strong: Scituate Community Response and Mutual Aid

div.p:
This page was designed to facilitate community response during the COVID-19 health emergency.
Scituate residents may request help or sign up to donate and/or volunteer.

SANDS Helps is collaborating with Scituate Community Christmas, Scituate Public Schools, Scituate Food Pantry, Scituate Council on Aging and Scituate FACTS to meet the needs of our residents. Where possible, we encourage “Neighbors Helping Neighbors” as your first option. Additionally, you can call 2-1-1 or visit Mass211.org for greater assistance and resources. As always, for any emergencies please call 9-1-1.
If you have feedback about this page or would like to suggest a resource to share, please email info@sandshelps.org.

p.br:
Scituate Health Department at 781-545-8725
LOCAL RESOURCES
Official Notices from the Town of Scituate
Scituate Outreach Services | Council on Aging
Code Red Enrollment
Scituate Public Schools Response
Scituate Public Schools Enrichment Learning Opportunities
Interface Referral Service
STATE RESOURCES
Massachusetts Department of Public Health
Massachusetts Unemployment Benefits
Mass 211
Listing of “Essential Services”
Buoy Health - Assess your risk
Nursing Home Family Resource Line - (617) 660-5399
NATIONAL RESOURCES
Center for Disease Control
John Hopkins Live GIS - COVID19
SUPPORT OUR LOCAL BUSINESSES
Scituate businesses, along with the Scituate Chamber of Commerce, are coming up with many creative ways to help us keep our social distance while we enjoy good food and restock our shelves. Even with the statewide ban on indoor service, restaurants can still offer takeout and delivery. Your purchases will help our neighborhood businesses stay healthy.
Are you a business owner with a service to share?
Click below to add your listing/offering and share with others.

div.class: image-block-outer-wrapper layout-caption-below design-layout-inline combination-animation-none individual-animation-none individual-text-animation-none

p.strong: SUGGEST A RESOURCE TO ADD BY EMAILING US

SANDS is offering cloth face coverings to Scituate residents at no charge. Sign up today: https://t.co/LxxABGGu0L https://t.co/SVRrqgFEQr
Scituate residents may apply now for a pedestrian face mask online https://t.co/LxxABGGu0L https://t.co/r7zXNQiVDa

img.alt: Need a face mask for you or a family member, sign up on our website www.sandshelps.org. @mahigold
Need a face mask for you or a family member, sign up on our website www.sandshelps.org. @mahigold
Face masks are a huge need right now. The CDC has put out diy instructions as well. www.cdc.gov. We are all in this together!
Face masks are a huge need right now. The CDC has put out diy instructions as well. www.cdc.gov. We are all in this together!

Through partnership and collaboration, we are prepared to deliver the shared resources our community needs now to address the current COVID-19 health crisis. SANDS Helps has taken a lead role in disaster assistance along with support from Scituate Community Christmas, Scituate Food Pantry, Scituate Public Schools, Scituate Council on Aging and Scituate FACTS. How can you help? 1. Please share this link/ site with your friends, family and neighbors: https://sandshelps.org/covid19. 2. Sign up to volunteer: www.sandshelps.org/volunteer 3. Understand that we are doing our best everyday, by the hour, to become a more resilient community. 4. Practice and follow the mandates issued by our local govt officials. 5. Follow SANDS Helps on Facebook and Twitter. #scituatemutualaid #SANDShelps #communitycollaboration # neighborshelpingneighbors #covid19

Through partnership and collaboration, we are prepared to deliver the shared resources our community needs now to address the current COVID-19 health crisis. SANDS Helps has taken a lead role in disaster assistance along with support from Scituate Community Christmas, Scituate Food Pantry, Scituate Public Schools, Scituate Council on Aging and Scituate FACTS. How can you help? 1. Please share this link/ site with your friends, family and neighbors: https://sandshelps.org/covid19. 2. Sign up to volunteer: www.sandshelps.org/volunteer 3. Understand that we are doing our best everyday, by the hour, to become a more resilient community. 4. Practice and follow the mandates issued by our local govt officials. 5. Follow SANDS Helps on Facebook and Twitter. #scituatemutualaid #SANDShelps #communitycollaboration # neighborshelpingneighbors #covid19
Thank you “helpers”. We appreciate you everyday but in times like these you always rise above and beyond. #scituate
Thank you “helpers”. We appreciate you everyday but in times like these you always rise above and beyond. #scituate

While we work with town and community partners to identify how to best serve Scituate residents, we encourage everyone to utilize 2-1-1, when necessary.
Every day, someone somewhere in Massachusetts needs to find essential community services, an after school program, a food bank, or where to secure care for an aging parent. Many face these challenges, but don't always know where to turn for help. The Solution is to Dial 2-1-1 or visit www.mass211.org. Mass 211 is an easy to remember telephone number that connects callers to information about critical health and human services available in their community. It serves as a resource for finding government benefits and services, nonprofit organizations, support groups, volunteer opportunities, donation programs, and other local resources. Always a confidential call, Mass 211 maintains the integrity of the 9-1-1 system saving that vital community resource for life and death emergencies.
And please - if dialing 9-1-1 for an emergency - alert dispatchers of any flu or cold-like symptoms or exposures in your home.

While we work with town and community partners to identify how to best serve Scituate residents, we encourage everyone to utilize 2-1-1, when necessary.
Every day, someone somewhere in Massachusetts needs to find essential community services, an after school program, a food bank, or where to secure care for an aging parent. Many face these challenges, but don't always know where to turn for help. The Solution is to Dial 2-1-1 or visit www.mass211.org. Mass 211 is an easy to remember telephone number that connects callers to information about critical health and human services available in their community. It serves as a resource for finding government benefits and services, nonprofit organizations, support groups, volunteer opportunities, donation programs, and other local resources. Always a confidential call, Mass 211 maintains the integrity of the 9-1-1 system saving that vital community resource for life and death emergencies.
And please - if dialing 9-1-1 for an emergency - alert dispatchers of any flu or cold-like symptoms or exposures in your home.

div.p: SANDS Helps | 125 Mann Lot Rd. | Scituate, MA 02066
